member.name: M:Intuit.Ipp.AsyncServices.AsyncExtensions.AccountBalancesReportAsync(Intuit.Ipp.Services.ReportingServices,Intuit.Ipp.Data.Qbd.ReportAccountBalances)
member.summary: Returns all accounts along with their balances.

member.name: M:Intuit.Ipp.AsyncServices.AsyncExtensions.BalanceSheetStandardReportAsync(Intuit.Ipp.Services.ReportingServices,Intuit.Ipp.Data.Qbd.BalanceSheetStd)
member.summary: This report provides a financial snapshot of your company for a specified date. The report calculates how much your business is worth (your business's equity) by subtracting all the money your company owes (liabilities) from everything it owns (assets). The total for equity includes your company's net income for the fiscal year to date.

member.name: M:Intuit.Ipp.AsyncServices.AsyncExtensions.CustomersWhoOwesMeReportAsync(Intuit.Ipp.Services.ReportingServices,Intuit.Ipp.Data.Qbd.ReportCustomersWhoOweMe)
member.summary: Returns a list of customers who owe a balance, the amount owed, and the due date.

member.name: M:Intuit.Ipp.AsyncServices.AsyncExtensions.IncomeBreakdownReportAsync(Intuit.Ipp.Services.ReportingServices,Intuit.Ipp.Data.Qbd.ReportIncomeBreakdown)
member.summary: Returns income accounts and current balances. With POSTs you can use optional filtering by start and end dates.

member.name: M:Intuit.Ipp.AsyncServices.AsyncExtensions.ProfitAndLossReportAsync(Intuit.Ipp.Services.ReportingServices,Intuit.Ipp.Data.Qbd.ReportProfitAndLoss)
member.summary: A profit and loss report can be defined as your income statement. This report summarizes the income and expenses for a selected duration and helps you determine the profit or loss status. The report also displays the subtotals of each income or expense account in your chart-of-accounts.

member.name: M:Intuit.Ipp.AsyncServices.AsyncExtensions.SalesSummaryReportAsync(Intuit.Ipp.Services.ReportingServices,Intuit.Ipp.Data.Qbd.ReportSalesSummary)
member.summary: Returns the total sales data for all customers, with an optional date filter for POSTs.

member.name: M:Intuit.Ipp.AsyncServices.AsyncExtensions.TopCustomersBySalesReportAsync(Intuit.Ipp.Services.ReportingServices,Intuit.Ipp.Data.Qbd.ReportTopCustomersBySales)
member.summary: Returns customers and sales data, with an optional date filter for POSTS.

member.name: M:Intuit.Ipp.AsyncServices.AsyncExtensions.Summary1099ReportAsync(Intuit.Ipp.Services.ReportingServices,Intuit.Ipp.Data.Qbd.Summary1099)
member.summary: The Summary 1099 report displays the amounts spent with each vendor that your company has specified as a 1099 vendor. This report helps you to fill the 1099-MISC tax form. The report summarizes the cash outflows to each vendor for whom your company files a 1099-MISC form. The report shows the vendors who are specified as 1099 vendors. Summary1099 report contains sensitive information about a tax Id, which is specified in the Social Security number (SSN) or the VendorTaxID element. The sensitive information is visible based on the role that is assigned to you. If you are assigned the Sensitive Report role, you can view the Summary1099 report but sensitive information in the report remains hidden from you. However, if you need to access sensitive information, you require permission from the Realm admin. If you are assigned the Confidential Data role, you can view both the Summary1099 report and sensitive information. If you are not assigned any of the above role, you cannot query for the Summary1099 report. Realm admin can access sensitive information present in the report, but the App admin and other users require permission from the Realm admin to view or to access this information.

member.name: M:Intuit.Ipp.AsyncServices.AsyncExtensions.CustomTxnDetailsReportAsync(Intuit.Ipp.Services.ReportingServices,Intuit.Ipp.Data.Qbd.CustomTxnDetail)
member.summary: This report lists individual transactions. If a transaction involves multiple accounts, each account is listed a separate line. For example, a check written to the telephone company would have two lines in the report. One line will show that the check was written from your checking account. The other line will show that you assigned the amount in your check to your telephone expense account.

member.summary: The Summary 1099 report displays the amounts spent with each vendor that your company has specified as a 1099 vendor. This report helps you to fill the 1099-MISC tax form. The report summarizes the cash outflows to each vendor for whom your company files a 1099-MISC form. The report shows the vendors who are specified as 1099 vendors. Summary1099 report contains sensitive information about a tax Id, which is specified in the Social Security number (SSN) or the VendorTaxID element. The sensitive information is visible based on the role that is assigned to you. If you are assigned the Sensitive Report role, you can view the Summary1099 report but sensitive information in the report remains hidden from you. However, if you need to access sensitive information, you require permission from the Realm admin. If you are assigned the Confidential Data role, you can view both the Summary1099 report and sensitive information. If you are not assigned any of the above role, you cannot query for the Summary1099 report. Realm admin can access sensitive information present in the report, but the App admin and other users require permission from the Realm admin to view or to access this information.
